entries.name: Ability Scores:
entries: 1 Cha, +2 Any

entries.name: Size:
entries: Your size is small

entries.name: Speed:
entries: 35 ft

entries.name: Fiend:
entries: You are both Fiend and Humanoid

entries.name: Devilish Resistance:
entries: Your infernal bloodline gives you resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Darkvision:
entries: You can seem in dim light within 60ft of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages:
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Infernal.

entries.name: Impish Parentage:
entries: As an Imp Devilkin, you are the spawn of an Imp and a human or other similar humanoid. You may be an incarnate of yourself from a previous life that had been the victim of an infernal contract and turned to this new form in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Appearance:
entries: You take on many of the aspects that the Imp devil takes on. Your skin has a hue of red, you have a pair of small horns, a tail that is either whip-like or having a spine on the end. You can contort your smile into a mischevious maw of sharp teeth. Although you have adopted the wings from your Imp parentage, they are much too small to make  use of them.

entries.name: Infernal Heritage:
entries: You know the minor illusion cantrip. When you reach 3rd level you can cast the {@spell Hex} spell once per long rest, and when you reach 5th level you can cast the {@spell Invisibility} spell once with this trait. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you take this race you choose whether Charisma or Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

items.name: Radiant Consumption.
items.entry: Searing light temporarily radiates from your eyes and mouth. For the duration, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Impish Stature:
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

trait.name: Jump (Maneuver)
entries: If the Devil's Ride moves at least 30 feet in a straight line, it can clear a distance of up to 60 feet when jumping over a chasm, ravine, or other gap. Each foot it clears on the jump costs a foot of movement.

trait.name: Stunt (Maneuver)
entries: On its turn, the driver of the Devil's Ride can expend 10 feet of movement to perform one free vehicle stunt, such as a wheelie or a burnout. Before the stunt can be performed, the Devil's Ride must move at least 10 feet in a straight line. If the driver succeeds on a DC 10 Dexterity check using the bike's Dexterity, the stunt is successful. Otherwise, the driver is unable to perform the stunt and can't attempt another stunt until the start of its next turn. If the check fails by 5 or more, the Devil's Ride and all creatures riding it immediately fall prone as the bike wipes out and comes to a dead stop.

trait.name: Prone Deficiency
entries: If the Devil's Ride falls prone, it can't right itself and is incapacitated until pulled upright.

actionStation.name: Drive (Helm Action)
entries: Drive and steer the Devil's Ride.

actionStation.name: Floor It (Helm Bonus Action)
entries: Double the movement speed of the devil's ride until the end of your turn.

reaction.name: Juke (Helm Reaction)
entries: If the Devil's Ride is able to move, the driver can use its reaction to grant the Devil's Ride advantage on a Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Crushing Wheels (Maneuver)
entries: The Tormentor can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature. When it does, the creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.If the creature was already prone, it takes an extra 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage.This trait can't be used against a particular creature more than once each turn.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Tormentor's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Prone Deficiency
entries: If the Tormentor rolls over and falls prone, it can't right itself and is incapacitated until flipped upright.

trait.name: Raking Scythes (Maneuver)
entries: When the Tormentor moves within 5 feet of a creature that isn't prone or another vehicle for the first time on a turn, it can rake the creature or vehicle with its protruding blades for 13 (2d10 + 2) slashing damage. A creature moves out of the way and takes no damage if it succeeds on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw.A vehicle moves out of the way and takes no damage if its driver succeeds on the saving throw.

actionStation.name: Drive (Helm Action)
entries: Drive and steer the Devil's Ride.

actionStation.name: Floor It (Helm Bonus Action)
entries: Double the movement speed of the devil's ride until the end of your turn.

actionStation.name: Fire Harpoon (Harpoon Flinger Action)
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Juke (Helm Reaction)
entries: If the Tormentor is able to move, the driver can use its reaction to grant the Tormentor advantage on a Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rargitch makes 1 cane and 1 radiant dagger attack. If Rargitch is focused he makes an additional cane or holy hammer attack.

action.name: Cane
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. Once per round Rargitch can charge his cane attack dealing an extra {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage. Once he does so, attacks against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Daemon Dagger
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Righteous Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The rargitch fell omen is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The rargitch fell omen's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the rargitch fell omen fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Focus (1/Day)
entries: When Rargitch drops below half his hit point maximum, he starts taking the battle seriously and gains access to new abilities, which are included in the stat block. He can use 1 additional legendary action each round. In addition, he immediately makes one crush attack at the end of the turn where his focus activates. .

reaction.name: Tail Swipe
entries: When a creature ends its turn in a space behind Rargitch, Rargitch can use his reaction to make a tail attack against them.

reaction.name: Dagger Throw
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of Rargitch uses a healing item or casts a spell Rargitch can use his reaction to make a ranged Daemon Dagger attack against the target.

legendary.name: Dangerous Retreat
entries: Rargitch makes 2 Daemon Dagger attacks and then leaps 20 feet to an empty space that he can see without triggering attacks of oppportunities.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gargoyle makes four attacks, each with one of the crystal appendages protruding from it's arms. All of these attacks are Crystal Smash attacks, one may be substituted with an impale attack.

action.name: Crystal Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Impaling Crystal
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 2d20 + 6}) damage.

action.name: Light Shower {@recharge 5}
entries: The gargoyle targets all creatures in a 10ft square within 60ft of the golem, forcing all creatures to make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, targets take {@damage 6d8} Radiant damage and half as much on a success. The targets are also burned with a radiant blight that keeps them from being healed until the start of the gargoyle's next turn.

Abhorrent overlords are gaunt, bipedal creatures whose gray, leathery skin is in stark contrast to the gleaming jewelry made of Underworld gold that they adorn themselves with. Their appetite for pain and death is eclipsed only by their greed; these fiends delight in searching out treasure and slaughtering all who stand in their way.

reaction.name: Radiate
entries: If attacked by a creature within 10ft, the gargoyle may use its reaction to flash its light brightly at the creature causing the creature to take a {@dice 1d4} penalty to the attack.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The crystal gargoyle is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Light Intensity
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the illuminated golem and can see the golem must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of the creature's next turn.

A creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the golem until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the golem in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The crystal gargoyle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

legendary.name: Crystal Glide
entries: The gargoyle may move up to its movement speed in a straight line, not provoking opportunity attacks. If the gargoyle passes by a creature within 5ft of it during this they may make one crystal smash attack on them.

legendary.name: Cruel Drop
entries: The gargoyle m ay attempt to grapple a creature with one attack, then move up to its movement speed straight up into the air.

monster.name: Augmented Bone Collective

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The collective has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The collective makes three attacks: one with its Flurry of Bones, one to encase, and one with its Bone Throw.

action.name: Flurry of Bones
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Encase in Bones
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The typhon can have up to two creatures constricted.

action.name: Bone Throw
entries: The bone collective may choose a single target within 30ft of the collective. The targeted creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take ({@dice 4d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. (Recharge 5-6)

Titanic horrors of writhing flesh and gnashing maws, typhons slither through the Underworld seeking only to consume. Once the souls of mortal warlords and cruel tyrants, typhons come into being over ages of festering bitterness and rage. Over time, these souls twist into eternally ravenous monstrosities, which rampage through the realm of the dead, consuming souls by the thousands. The Underworld remains their prison, though, and most would relish nothing more than to escape and slaughter the living once more.

legendaryHeader: The bone collective can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The bone collective regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bone Tumble
entries: The Bone Collective may move up to 15ft away, not provoking opportunity attacks, causing tremors in the ground as it seeps into the ground and the bones of the collective rumble. Each creature in it's path must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} Bludgeoning Damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, the target is not knocked {@condition prone} and takes half as much damage.

trait.name: Translucent Body
entries: The body of the demanglerfish is translucent except for its light and part of its brain, giving it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The demanglerfish has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demanglerfish makes an attack with its tail whip and an attack with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 17} strength saving throw or lose 10ft of movement speed on their next turn as they are spun up in a gust of current.

action.name: Light Flash {@recharge 5}
entries: The demanglerfish uses it's light and flashes it in a 60ft cone in front of it. Each creature caught in the flash must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} Radiant damage and be {@condition blinded} or take half as much on a success with no blindness.

Abhorrent overlords are gaunt, bipedal creatures whose gray, leathery skin is in stark contrast to the gleaming jewelry made of Underworld gold that they adorn themselves with. Their appetite for pain and death is eclipsed only by their greed; these fiends delight in searching out treasure and slaughtering all who stand in their way.

reaction.name: Light Strobe
entries: If attacked by a creature within 10ft, the demanglerfish may use its reaction to flash its light rapidly at the creature causing the creature to take a {@dice 1d4} penalty to the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drab makes two pincher attacks

action.name: Pincher
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}. If the creature is huge or larger, the target is not {@condition grappled}. The {@condition grappled} creature may use its action to attempt to escape (escape {@dc 14})

reaction.name: Claw Shield
entries: If a creature makes an attack on the crab, the drab may use a pincher to shield them from the attack, granting them a +2 to their AC. If it causes the attack to miss, the drab is still hit but only takes half damage from the attack.

The Shadowfell turns visitors around until they become marooned in its twisted landscape. Lost sorrowsworn—often referred to as the Lost—are representations of the anxiety and fear people experience when they can't find their way. These sorrowsworn appear desperate and panicked.

Lost sorrowsworn grasp at any creatures they can reach. A victim experiences a flood of fear and panic as its mind buckles under the fury of this assault. The harder a victim's allies fight to break the grasp, the more the victim suffers.

entries.name: Sorrowsworn
entries: The Shadowfell's pervasive melancholy sometimes gives rise to strange incarnations of the plane's bleak nature. Sorrowsworn embody the forms of suffering inherent to the shadowy landscape and visit horror on those who stumble into their midst. Each sorrowsworn personifies a different aspect of despair or distress.

bonus.name: Propulse
entries: Leaving a trail of fine bubbles and turbulence, the crab may use its bonus action to take the dash action.

bonus.name: Crunch
entries: The drab may use its bonus action to crunch a creature caught in it's pinchers, dealing {@damage 3d10 + 3} bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the drab remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The drab can breathe air and water.
